main_definition: Prime refers to a number greater than 1 that has no positive divisors other than 1 and itself.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In mathematics, prime is an integer greater than 1 that cannot be formed by multiplying two smaller natural numbers.
meanings_and_examples.example: The number 5 is a prime because it can only be divided evenly by 1 and itself.

meanings_and_examples.definition: When referring to time or dates, 'prime' means the first day of the month.
meanings_and_examples.example: Today is the prime, so many people celebrate with special activities or events.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In real estate and housing market, a property considered desirable due to its location, size, condition, etc., can be referred to as 'prime'.
meanings_and_examples.example: The house on Maple Street is in a prime location with stunning views.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In the entertainment industry, a film or show that attracts widespread attention and high audience ratings can be described as 'prime'.
meanings_and_examples.example: The new superhero movie was very successful during its prime weekend at the box office.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In finance, a loan or debt that has not been paid back to a lender for over 30 days and is now considered in default may be called 'prime'.
meanings_and_examples.example: Their prime status was revoked when they failed to make the minimum monthly payments on time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In computing, 'prime' can refer to a key or value that holds unique importance within an algorithm or data set.
meanings_and_examples.example: When searching for information online, prime keywords are those that yield precise results and relevant content.
